Description: Three lines of the same text, written in formal hieroglyphs, hieratic and demotic; below three more lines written in the same scripts; to the left, a coin of Ptolemy II, recto, the laureate profile head of Zeus Ammon; verso, the coin much obscured, an eagle and Greek script visible under a layer of dirt or rust; to the right, two lead seals from mummy wrappings both with bearded profile heads and Greek script, tied to fragments of linen; illustration to Pettigrew's "A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians" (1834) Etching
Curator's comments: For the coin, see 2010,4003.28 in the museum's collection.
Bibliographic references: Reid 1871 / A descriptive catalogue of the works of George Cruikshank (1629)
Associated titles: A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians
